SpeechSynthesisUtterance.summary:
The SpeechSynthesisUtterance interface of the Web Speech API represents a speech request.
It contains the content the speech service should read and information about how to read it (e.g., language, pitch and volume.)

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceBoundary.summary: The boundary event of the Web Speech API is fired when the spoken utterance reaches a word or sentence boundary.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceEnd.summary: The end event of the Web Speech API object is fired when the utterance has finished being spoken.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceError.summary: The error event of the Web Speech API object is fired when an error occurs that prevents the utterance from being successfully spoken.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceLang.summary: The lang property of the interface gets and sets the language of the utterance.

remarks.para: If unset, the app's (i.e., the html lang value) lang will be used, or the user-agent default if that is unset too.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceLang.value: A string representing a BCP 47 language tag.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceMark.summary: The mark event of the Web Speech API object is fired when the spoken utterance reaches a named SSML "mark" tag.

SpeechSynthesisUtterancePause.summary: The pause event of the Web Speech API object is fired when the utterance is paused part way through.

SpeechSynthesisUtterancePitch.summary: The pitch property of the interface gets and sets the pitch at which the utterance will be spoken at.

remarks.para: If unset, a default value of 1 will be used.

SpeechSynthesisUtterancePitch.value:
A float representing the pitch value.
It can range between 0 (lowest) and 2 (highest), with 1 being the default pitch for the current platform or voice. Some speech synthesis engines or voices may constrain the minimum and maximum rates further.
If SSML is used, this value will be overridden by prosody tags in the markup.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceRate.summary: The rate property of the interface gets and sets the speed at which the utterance will be spoken at.

remarks.para: If unset, a default value of 1 will be used.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceRate.value:
A float representing the rate value.
It can range between 0.1 (lowest) and 10 (highest), with 1 being the default rate for the current platform or voice, which should correspond to a normal speaking rate.
Other values act as a percentage relative to this, so for example 2 is twice as fast, 0.5 is half as fast, etc.Some speech synthesis engines or voices may constrain the minimum and maximum rates further.
If SSML is used, this value will be overridden by prosody tags in the markup.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceResume.summary: The resume event of the Web Speech API object is fired when a paused utterance is resumed.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceSpeechSynthesisU.summary: The SpeechSynthesisUtterance() constructor of the interface returns a new SpeechSynthesisUtterance object instance.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceStart.summary: The start event of the Web Speech API object is fired when the utterance has begun to be spoken.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceText.summary:
The text property of the
interface gets and sets the text that will be synthesized when the utterance is spoken.

remarks.para:
The text may be provided as plain text, or a well-formed SSML document.
The SSML tags will be stripped away by devices that don't support SSML.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceText.value:
A string representing the text to the synthesized.
The maximum length of the text that can be spoken in each utterance is 32,767 characters.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceVoice.summary: The voice property of the interface gets and sets the voice that will be used to speak the utterance.

remarks.para:
This should be set to one of the objects returned by .
If not set by the time the utterance is spoken, the voice used will be the most suitable default voice available for the utterance's setting.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceVolume.summary: The volume property of the interface gets and sets the volume that the utterance will be spoken at.

remarks.para: If not set, the default value 1 will be used.

SpeechSynthesisUtteranceVolume.value: A float that represents the volume value, between 0 (lowest) and 1 (highest.)If SSML is used, this value will be overridden by prosody tags in the markup.
